alert.note: Alert for Marengo; Perry; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 6:41AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Marengo, southwestern Perry and southeastern Sumter Counties through 745 AM CDT... At 640 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coatopa, or 13 miles southeast of York, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Demopolis, Livingston, Linden, Jefferson, Thomaston, Myrtlewood, Faunsdale, Dayton, Freddie Jones Field, Pin Hook, Consul, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Chickasaw State Park, U.S. 80 and AL 28, Old Spring Hill, Lilita, McDowell, Calvary and Bellamy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
